com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats

Class BaseAccumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.BaseAccumulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IAccumulator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Accumulator, AggregatingStatisticalAccumulator, HistogramAccumulator, StoringStatisticalAccumulator

    public abstract class BaseAccumulator
extends AbstractConfigurable
implements IAccumulator
    Abstract base class for IAccumulator implementations. It provides the common configuration functionality supporting following properties:
    • dumpEvery - see setSampleSize(int). Default 0 (never)
    • numberOfMessagesIgnoredAtStartup - see setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int). Default 0

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • getConfiguration

        public IConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Return the last valid configuration.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface IConfigurable
        Returns:
        Reference to the last IConfiguration used to successfully configure this IConfigurable.

      • getNumIgnoredAtStartup

        public int getNumIgnoredAtStartup()
        Description copied from interface: IAccumulator
        Returns number of values to ignore at start up. Configuration property.
        Specified by:
        getNumIgnoredAtStartup in interface IAccumulator
        Returns:
        Number of samples ignored at startup
        See Also:
        setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int)

      • setNumIgnoredAtStartup

        public void setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int numIgnoredAtStartup)
        Sets the number of first data points that are ignored - not taken into account for statistics. It may be useful as sometimes you want to omit the samples at startup, as they may not be representative because of the startup warm-up.
        Specified by:
        setNumIgnoredAtStartup in interface IAccumulator
        Parameters:
        numIgnoredAtStartup - Number of samples ignored at startup.

      • setSampleSize

        public void setSampleSize(int dumpEvery)
        After this many accumulated data points, the accumulator will display the data to standard output. This may additionally wipe the data after this occurs.
        Specified by:
        setSampleSize in interface IAccumulator
        Parameters:
        dumpEvery - Number of data points before dumping stats and clearing.

      • getSampleSize

        public int getSampleSize()
        Description copied from interface: IAccumulator
        After this many accumulated data points, the accumulator will display the data to standard output and reset the statistics Configuration property.
        Specified by:
        getSampleSize in interface IAccumulator
        Returns:
        Number of data points before dumping stats and clearing
        See Also:
        setSampleSize(int)
